isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Lubrication and Maintenance - Operating Information

svcsubproc.title: Magnets and Magnetic Drain Plugs
svcsubproc.para: Most Meritor transfer cases are equipped with magnetic plugs having a minimum pick-up capacity of 20 oz (0.57 kg) of low carbon steel.

note.para: Replace the magnetic drain plug each time the oil is changed. Use the correct part. Pipe plugs will leak if used as a drain plug.

svcsubproc.para: The magnetic drain plug can be reused, if, after cleaning, the plug has a minimum pick-up capacity of 20 oz (0.57 kg) of low carbon steel.

svcsubproc.title: Breather

caution.para: Cover the breather when steam cleaning the housing. If the breather is not covered, water can enter the housing and contaminate the oil.

svcsubproc.para: Breathers release pressure that builds up inside the transfer case during vehicle operation (Figure 84).

svcsubproc.title: Seals

caution.para: Always use the correct tools and procedures when you replace a seal. A seal that is not correctly installed can leak. damage to components can result.

svcsubproc.para: Seals keep lubricant in and dirt out of a component. When they are worn or damaged, seals leak and produce low lubricant levels which may damage components.
Always replace seals after yokes have been removed.

caution.para: Transfer cases may operate above 190°F (88°C) without damage. However, if the oil temperature reaches 250°F (121°C), stop the vehicle immediately and check for the cause of overheating. Maximum continuous running oil temperature should not exceed 225°F (107°C). Damage to components can result.
